page.title: 04ROAD SCHEMES FOR MAIDSTONE
page.content: Kent County Council proposes to invest Â£30 million in{3 major road schemes}to ease congestion in its county town and to improve north-south traffic flows and access to the west-east M20. The first scheme, to start in 1987, involves a{viaduct across the Len {Valley}linking Sittingbourne Road to Mote Road. Another will connect the second Medway bridge, opened in 1978, to the A229 Chatham Road by a{dual {carriageway using Fairmeadow}and the site of Maidstone Barracks. The most ambitious project, planned for the 1990s, is a dual carriageway{ {Southern Approach Road}from the Loose Road end of Sheals Crescent to Bishops Way via a roundabout on the site of Foster and Brunswick Streets. This scheme will avoid listed buildings, but involve the demolition of 89 homes and the blighting of many others.
